result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian A Turck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case #15CM325.
Court authorizes early termination of Probation, but after 9 months, if defendant successfully completes Probation.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Court orders defendant to complete G.E.D. or high school diploma within the First 8 months of Probation
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Father.  Agent authorized to permit No Violent contact with Father, if Father requests it.
Domestic Violence Counseling within the First 9 month of Probation.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license ONLY and get valid driver's license with the First 4 months of Probation..

Case #14CM1272 was Dismissed and Read into Case #15CM325 and #15CM669.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian A Turck

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Christian A Turck in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER, w/Standard Release Conditions; consecutive to 15CM325

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
- Court orders defendant to complete G.E.D. or high school diploma within the first 8 months of probation.
*No contact with: Father. Agent authorized to permit no violant contact with Father, if father requests it.
*Domestic Violence Counseling within first 9 months of probation period.
*Operate motor vehicle with a valid license only, and get valid driver license within the first 4 months of probation.

RESTITUTION:  $0 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00. Apply cash bail to this case and 15CM325, refund any balance.

Court authorizes early termination of probation, but after 9 months, if defendant successfully completes probation.
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christian A Turck in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court needs to reschedule the case due to a scheduling conflict.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christian A Turck in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: May 18, 2015 Hearing.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Christian A Turck in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith, Jr. for  M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
